entry.title: Ordinal Inscriptions Approach 19 Million Amid Stagnant Fees, Bitcoin NFT Sales Drop
entry.summary:
The number of Bitcoin Ordinal inscriptions on the blockchain is nearing 19 million, a trend that has continued for the past 218 days since December 16, 2022. Statistics indicate that miners have accrued roughly 1,847.66 BTC in fees, worth about $55.29 million, confirming the millions of Ordinal inscriptions.
Bitcoin‚Äôs Ordinal Inscriptions Near 19 Million
As of July 22, 2023, at block height 799,830, approximately 18,599,837 Ordinal inscriptions have been issued on the bitcoin blockchain. The trend has continued to rise since the first inscription 218 days ago. Archived statistics from Dune Analytics indicate that 78.5% of all the inscriptions minted on Bitcoin are in plain text form or character sets, while another 13.5% is plain text, bringing the total of plain text and character set‚Ä¶

Dormant $30 Million Bitcoin Cache Roused After 11 Years: 8 Sleeping Wallets From 2012 Stirred to Life in July
entry.summary:
Under the cover of darkness early Saturday morning, July 22, 2023, precisely at 12:51 a.m. UTC, a former dormant bitcoin address, home to 1,037.42 BTC‚Äîvalued at $30 million‚Äîstirred to life for the first time since 2012.
Long-dormant Bitcoin Address Springs to Life, Moving $30 Million Hoard
July has seen eight so-called ‚Äòsleeping‚Äô bitcoin wallets, untouched since 2012, break their over 11-year hibernation, initiating transactions for the first time. A total of approximately 1,216.92 BTC, which had remained in a state of inertia for the past decade, were shifted this month. The prior seven instances of bitcoin activity from 2012, involving dormant wallets, totaled 179.50 BTC before the slumbering whale address moved a colossal 1,037.42 bitcoins on Saturday.

entry.title: Ripple Seeks Regulatory Nod, Applies For Crypto License In The UK
entry.summary:
After securing a major legal triumph against the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), Ripple, the blockchain payments firm, is now focusing on its expansion plans in Europe.
Ripple‚Äôs move to apply for registration with the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) and seek a payment institution license in Ireland further underscores the company‚Äôs commitment to responsibly navigating and embracing the regulatory landscape.
Recently, a judge in the United States ruled in favor of Ripple, stating that the company‚Äôs sales of the cryptocurrency XRP do not qualify as investment contracts. This was a significant legal success for Ripple.
Legal Victory Sparks XRP Surge
This landmark decision sparked a staggering 60% surge in XRP‚Äôs value within a week, signifying that cryptocurrencies mig‚Ä¶

SEC Accepts Blackrock‚Äôs Bitcoin ETF Application
The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has accepted the application for a bitcoin exchange-traded fund (ETF) filed by asset manager Blackrock. The move indicates the regulator is preparing to seriously consider a bitcoin ETF and could eventually set the stage for wider adoption of crypto assets and produ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Former SEC Chief: Regulator Stands A Chance Of Winning Appeal Vs. Ripple
entry.summary:
The crypto space and the financial world at large are currently reacting to news that the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) may appeal the recent court ruling in its case against the blockchain company Ripple.
This development was revealed in the federal regulator‚Äôs latest petition in a separate ongoing lawsuit against Korean crypto investor Do Kwon and his company Terraform Labs, both of which are accused of committing fraud.
Is The SEC Planning To Make An Appeal Against Ripple‚Äôs Victory?
On July 13, Ripple gained a significant victory over the U.S. regulator when a U.S. District Court ruled that the sale of the XRP tokens to retail investors did not breach U.S. securities law. However, the case was the opposite with regard to sales to institutional investors‚Ä¶

entry.title: Amanda Cavaleri On Bitcoin Culture, Adoption And Preserving Wisdom For Future Generations
entry.summary: Bitcoin possesses a unique identity and qualities that are cemented on the foundation of decentralization. Almost everyone who is doing the work to understand Bitcoin will eventually run into the cold, hard fact that, at its core, Bitcoin is about freedom. To those who have enjoyed individual liberties for their entire lives, the concept of freedom may be watered down or under appreciated. For those who live without it, freedom and individual liberty become pursuits of great importance. Many people who are diving into Bitcoin will find themselves at a crossroads, having to choose between the speculative ‚Äúget-rich-quick‚Äù mania of some crypto subcultures and the self-sovereign, owner-and-builder mentality that Bitcoin offers. Amanda Cavaleri embodies the latter. Humble, empathetic and gene‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin Blood Money: Woman Gets 5 Years For Hiring Crypto Hitman To Kill Ex-Husband
entry.summary:
In a shocking revelation on the dark net, Bitcoin played a chilling role in a sinister plot masterminded by Kristy Lynn Felkins, a 38-year-old woman from Nevada.
Intent on carrying out an evil act, she sought the services of a hitman to execute a deadly plan targeting her ex-husband. As the cryptocurrency paved the way for anonymous transactions, it enabled the unfolding of a horrifying turn of events that shook the foundations of online anonymity and criminal intent.
The chilling narrative began in 2016 when Felkins initiated communication with an entity she believed to be a hitman-for-hire on a dark web platform. Unbeknownst to her, the website was a fa√ßade, a scam that preyed on unsuspecting customers seeking sinister services.
The supposed hitman, operating under pseudonyms, lure‚Ä¶

entry.title: Singapore, US With Highest Public Debt per Capita, China Most Indebted in BRICS: Study
entry.summary:
Singapore, the United States and Japan top the global chart in terms of sovereign debt per capita, according to research based on U.N. data. The burden of government debt for every American is 10 times heavier than that for a Chinese citizen, according to the study.
U.S. Ranks Second in the World by Debt per Citizen, China in Top 50
People in Singapore owed more than any other nation in 2022 as far as sovereign debt per capita is concerned, according to an analysis of data compiled by the United Nations. The share of each citizen of the city-state amounted to $117,400, according to the research conducted by the Russian RIA Novosti news agency.
The U.S. is second with $93,000 for each American. In June, the country‚Äôs debt surpassed the $32-trillion mark for the first time. That happen‚Ä¶

entry.title: Financial Woes: Binance France Discloses ‚Ç¨4 Million Loss In 2022 Financial Reports
entry.summary:
The French arm of Binance, established on November 8, 2021, disclosed its financial statement for the year 2022 on Friday. The leading auditing service firm RSM Paris audited the Binance platform and concluded that the exchange had faced a loss of ‚Ç¨4 million in France. It happened because the revenue earned from the exchange‚Äôs services was less than its expenses.
The regulatory barriers mainly caused Binance France to bear losses in its initial financial period. Though the crypto exchange entered the French jurisdiction in November 2021, the platform started offering trading and custody service in mid-2022 due to legal limits, resulting in a mismatch in the revenue and cost.
The published statement covers 14 months of expenses from Binance France‚Äôs creation in November 2021 to Decemb‚Ä¶

entry.title: Copy Trading Has ‚ÄòDisrupted the Crypto Industry‚Äô Says Bitget‚Äôs Gracy Chen
entry.summary:
Copy trading has disrupted the crypto industry and is increasingly the trading strategy preferred by less experienced traders says Gracy Chen, managing director of the crypto trading platform Bitget. While copy trading is gaining popularity globally, traders and prospective users from Africa appear more interested in the strategy than those from other regions.
Africa-Based Users More Interested in Copy Trading
According to Gracy Chen, the managing director of the crypto derivatives and copy trading platform Bitget, copying trading is a trading strategy which has not only ‚Äúdisrupted the crypto industry‚Äù but has become increasingly more popular with novice traders. She added that for some cases, copy trading has proven to be an effective strategy during the so-called ‚Äúcrypto winter.‚Äù

entry.title: BRICS Currency Not on Agenda for Leaders‚Äô Summit ‚Äî Nations to Focus on De-Dollarization
entry.summary:
The heavily anticipated BRICS currency is not on the agenda to be discussed at the economic bloc‚Äôs upcoming leaders‚Äô summit, according to South Africa‚Äôs diplomat in charge of BRICS relations. He clarified that the BRICS members will focus on de-dollarization and promoting the use of national currencies in international trade instead of the U.S. dollar.
BRICS to Focus on Reducing Dollar Reliance
The topic of a common BRICS currency is not on the agenda to be discussed at the economic group‚Äôs upcoming leaders‚Äô summit, South Africa‚Äôs diplomat in charge of BRICS relations, Anil Sooklal, reportedly said Thursday.

entry.title: Nigerian Social Payments Platform Bundle Ceases Crypto Exchange Operations
entry.summary:
The Nigerian social payments platform Bundle said on July 20 it was shutting down its crypto exchange services business and will now focus on its peer-to-peer platform known as Cashlink. Bundle said users must withdraw or convert their digital assets to the stablecoin tether on or before Aug. 30.
Bundle Says Transition Period Is to Last 60 Days
The Nigerian social payments platform, Bundle, said on July 20 that it was ceasing operations of its crypto exchange services and will now focus on the peer-to-peer platform known as Cashlink. In a statement, Bundle said the decision to shut down exchange services follows ‚Äúshareholders‚Äô decision to restructure the business to focus on Cashlink.‚Äù

entry.title: Charting Bitcoin‚Äôs Predictable Course: A Comprehensive Review of the Next 29 Reward Halvings
entry.summary:
In under 280 days, Bitcoin‚Äôs blockchain will undergo its fourth reward halving event, slicing the block subsidy from 6.25 BTC to 3.125 BTC. The crypto community is abuzz with chatter, contemplating how these substantial decreases in block rewards will transpire over the ensuing two decades, and speculating on how miners will cope with the impending reductions. The following is a glimpse at the timeline of these subsidy transformations and a projection of the future rewards in the distant horizon.

entry.title: Canadian Police Warn of Surge in Home Invasion-Style Robberies Targeting Affluent Crypto Investors
entry.summary:
Canadian law enforcement reports that affluent cryptocurrency investors have become targets of home invasion-style robberies. Both Delta Police and Royal Canadian Mounted Police in Richmond have issued warnings after having dealt with multiple robberies involving prominent cryptocurrency investors over the past year.
Wealthy Crypto Investors Become Targets in Canada
Over the last 12 months, numerous home invasions have targeted wealthy digital currency investors throughout Canada. A press release from Delta Police headquarters reveals that both Delta and Richmond‚Äôs Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) have responded to several such incidents.

entry.summary: The 20,000-strong Mythics NFT collection will be revealed gradually over the span of months as Moonbirds and Oddities holders claim them.

entry.title: Dr. Disrespect's 'Deadrop': Early Access Gameplay From Snapshot VI
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin playtests Dr. Disrespect and Midnight Society's first-person shooter Deadrop and shares the latest game updates, as well as her opinions on the game in development. Currently, Deadrop offers Polygon Founders Pass NFTs with no other crypto plans revealed just yet.

entry.title: 'More and More' Game Publishers Will Embrace NFTs: Mythical Games CEO
entry.summary: In the wake of EA Sports and Fortnite creator Epic Games embracing Nike's NFT platform, Mythical Games CEO John Linden tells Decrypt's Andrew Hayward how quickly he expects to see more major traditional game publishers enter the blockchain space and how quickly the industry will scale.

entry.title: Gran Saga Unlimited Early Access: Inside the Anime MMORPG on Aptos
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin plays Gran Saga: Unlimited's second community playtest, reports her findings, and offers her opinion and insights on the upcoming game, which will offer optional Aptos NFTs.

entry.title: 100 Thieves' Moe Says Blockchain Games Will 'Eventually' Be Accepted by Livestreamers
entry.summary: 100 Thieves content creator and gamer Moe also goes by "Yassuo" online after his favorite League of Legends character. Decrypt's Kate Irwin asks him about 100 Thieves' future crypto plans and whether Moe thinks creators like xQc and Pokimane might ever come around to blockchain games.

entry.title: "Games of the Future Are Going to Be Different," Says Splinterlands Cofounder
entry.summary: Splinterlands Cofounder Matt Rosen tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about how the game has evolved over its five-year history and why he doesn't listen to the FUD around crypto.

entry.title: Inside Champions Ascension: Like 'For Honor' with NFTs?
entry.summary: Plai Labs Marketing Director Payton Kaleiwahea tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about player response to the combat game Champions Ascension in development, which offers arena combat, raid bosses, AI landscape features, and more.

entry.title: Ex-Activision VP Michael Lee: Gaming Is Crypto's 'Killer App'
entry.summary: Former Activision Vice President Michael Lee is now the SVP of Growth at Matter Labs. At the 3XP gaming conference, Lee sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin to discuss crypto gaming and give his predictions for the industry.

entry.title: Behind the Scenes with AMGI Studios and My Pet Hooligan
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin goes to Burbank, California for a behind-the-scenes tour of AMGI Studios, the developers of upcoming game My Pet Hooligan.

entry.title: Why Legend of Arcadia Chose Sui Over EVM Chains
entry.summary: Legend of Arcadia Executive Producer Andy Lee tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the game and why they switched from EVM to new protocol Sui.

entry.title: Rumble Racing Star Game Preview: Is This Mario Kart With NFTs?
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin shares a first look at Delabs' upcoming lawn mower racing game Rumble Racing Star, which offers a large cast of quirky characters pulled from the worlds of Bored Ape Yacht Club, Pudgy Penguins, and more.

entry.title: Why Laguna Games Turned Down 'Game of Thrones' for Crypto Unicorns
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin chats with Laguna Games about why the team chose to move away from an offer with WB Games to develop a Game of Thrones licensed title‚Äîand made Crypto Unicorns instead.

entry.title: Mythical Games CEO John Linden on NFL Rivals Topping 1M Downloads
entry.summary: Mythical Games just raised a $37 million Series C1 round on the back of the early success of NFL Rivals, which has already topped a million downloads in two months. Mythical CEO John Linden joins Decrypt's Andrew Hayward to discuss the launch and impact of NFL Rivals.

entry.title: How Ava Labs Is Approaching Gaming on Avalanche
entry.summary: At 3XP, Ava Labs Head of Gaming Ed Chang sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin to discuss some of the biggest Avalanche-based games on the horizon and how the company is approaching and thinking about Web3 gaming.

entry.title: Ogimi Founder David Gull on Why AI Should Be Your Meditation Coach
entry.summary: Ogimi founder David Gull speaks with Decrypt's Jason Nelson about its AI-driven meditation guides and how the technology can enable a more unique, custom-tailored meditation experience for users.

entry.title: VaynerSports Gaming VP Discusses Web3 Content Creators, Decentralized Streaming
entry.summary: Darren Glover, VP of Gaming at talent management agency VaynerSports, sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at the 3XP expo to discuss the challenges faced by Web3-centric content creators, the current state of the esports market, and how decentralized streaming platforms can challenge centralized leaders like Twitch.
